Class Media

java.lang.Object
Media
Direct Known Subclasses:
Book, CD
public abstract class Media extends Object
Abstract class representing a generic media item in the library.

This class serves as the base for specific media types like Book and CD. It encapsulates common properties such as title, author, ISBN, and borrowing status, as well as business logic for borrowing, returning, and fine calculation.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Zainab

  • Constructor Details

    • Media

      public Media(String title, String author, String isbn, String status, String dueDate, double fineAmount, String borrowedBy, double amountPaid, int copyId)
      Constructor to initialize a Media object with full details.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the item.
      author - The author of the item.
      isbn - The ISBN or unique ID of the item.
      status - The current status (e.g., Available, Borrowed).
      dueDate - The due date if borrowed.
      fineAmount - The current fine amount.
      borrowedBy - The username of the borrower.
      amountPaid - The amount already paid towards the fine.

  • Method Details

    • now

      protected static LocalDate now()
      Gets the current date. This method is used to allow mocking of the current date during testing.
      Returns:
      The current LocalDate.

    • getLoanPeriod

      public abstract int getLoanPeriod()
      Returns the loan period for this specific media type.
      Returns:
      The number of days the item can be borrowed.

    • getBaseDailyFine

      public abstract double getBaseDailyFine()
      Returns the daily fine rate for this specific media type.
      Returns:
      The fine amount per day.

    • getMediaType

      public abstract String getMediaType()
      Returns the type of media as a string (e.g., "Book", "CD").
      Returns:
      The media type identifier.

      Gets the current fine amount.
      Returns:
      The fine amount.

    • setFine

      public void setFine(double fine)
      Sets the fine amount.
      Parameters:
      fine - The new fine amount.

    • getOverdueFine

      public double getOverdueFine()
      Gets the amount paid towards overdue fines.
      Returns:
      The paid amount.

    • setOverdueFine

      public void setOverdueFine(double overdueFine)
      Sets the amount paid towards overdue fines.
      Parameters:
      overdueFine - The paid amount.

    • borrow

      public void borrow(String username)
      Borrows the item for a specific user. Sets the status to "Borrowed", records the borrower, and calculates the due date.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the borrower.

    • returnMedia

      public void returnMedia()
      Returns the item to the library. Resets status to "Available" and clears borrower and fine information.

    • isOverdue

      public boolean isOverdue()
      Checks if the item is currently overdue.
      Returns:
      true if the current date is after the due date, false otherwise.

    • calculateFine

      public void calculateFine(String membershipType)
      Calculates the fine based on overdue days and user membership. Uses the FineCalculator strategy pattern.
      Parameters:
      membershipType - The user's membership type (e.g., "Gold", "Silver").

    • toFileFormat

      public String toFileFormat()
      Converts the media object to a CSV-formatted string for file storage.
      Returns:
      A comma-separated string containing media details.
